#Text=Pietrafesa ( painter )

#Text=Giovanni De Gregorio , known as il Pietrafesa ( 1579 or 1580 in Pietrafesa ( now Satriano di Lucania ) - 1656 in Pignola , active 1653 ) called thus after the ancient name of the place of origin , Satriano , the ancient Pietrafesa .
#Text=Giovanni De Gregorio , or Pietrafesa , was a Lucan painter .
#Text=Active in the Kingdom of Naples between 1608 and 1653 , he was a representative of the Neapolitan school .
#Text=He was an Italian painter of the Baroque period . [ 1 ]
#Text=He painted an altar-piece of the Assumption of the Virgin Mary for the chapel of the convent of Marsico Nuovo . [ 2 ]
#Text=Biography

#Text=De Gregorio was born in Petra-fixia , the ancient Satriano di Lucania , between 1579 and 1580 , as was written in a notary act dated from September 27 , 1595 , which states that he , son of Michele , at the age of 15 attended the Neapolitan workshop of Fabrizio Santafede .
#Text=He remained for six years in his workshop .

#Text=He frequented assiduously the picture gallery of the prince Matteo di Capua where he admired " Cristo " of Sebastiano del Piombo , from which he would draw the model of his religiosity and his images .
#Text=He devoted himself to painting with passion and scrupulous study , to which he added a vast culture and a profound religious sense of life .
#Text=After returning to Basilicata he moved to Vineola , today Pignola , where he married a woman from Pignola and had two children .
#Text=He opened his workshop , school for other artists including Giuseppe De Gregorio ( his adopted son ) , Girolamo Bresciano da Pietragalla and Francesco Romano da Laurenzana .
#Text=His artistic life took place between the province of Basilicata and that of Principato Citra ( Salerno ) .

#Text=But there is a gap to be filled in his biography , between 1601 , the year in which he finished his training in the workshop of Santafede , and 1608 when he produced his first signed work known as La Pietà , commissioned by the church of S. Francesco di Potenza .
#Text=From 1608 to 1653 he completed several works moving to different locations in the Kingdom of Naples .
#Text=He died in 1656 at the age of 67 suffering from a plague in Pignola and rests , according to Costantino Gatta , in the mother church of Pignola . [ 3 ]
#Text=Works
#Text=- Madonna del Rosario , Albano , parish church ;
#Text=- Coronation of the Virgin , Anzi , Church of St. Anthony ;
#Text=- Madonna and Child with Saints Giovanni Battista and Carlo Borromeo , Anzi , Church of S. Lucia ;
#Text=- Madonna with Child and Ss . Francesco , Lorenzo and Gaetano , Balvano , church of S. Antonio ;
#Text=- Madonna degli Angioli , Brienza , church of S. Maria degli Angeli ;
#Text=- Trinitas terrestris ed Eterno , Castelmezzano , parish church ;
#Text=- Crucifixion with Saint Dominic , Matera , Notary Archive ;
#Text=- S. Antonio da Padova , Missanello , parish church ;
#Text=- Deposition , Moliterno , church of the convent ;
#Text=- S. Antonio da Padova , Pietrapertosa , church of the convent ;
#Text=- Madonna with Child and Saints , Pignola , Mother Church ;
